data.author: Lorrie Goldstein
data.title: GOLDSTEIN: Parliament’s budget officer slices and dices Freeland budget
data.description: Independent, non-partisan Parliamentary Budget Officer Yves Giroux dismantled Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland’s first budget on Wednesday with the skill of a math professor marking a student’s Grade 8 arithmetic exam claiming that two plus two equals five. He said the document she unveiled April 19 overestimated how much it will help Canada’s economy recover from […]

data.author: Eve Ottenberg
data.title: Bernie on the Budget Committee
data.description: Those discouraged that Bernie Sanders was not appointed labor secretary can take solace in his role as chair of the senate budget committee. There he can accomplish far more for working people than he ever could at the labor department. The proof is staring us in the face – Sanders just shepherded the $1.9 trillion MoreThe post Bernie on the Budget Committee appeared first on CounterPunch.org.

data.title: NCAA Budget for Men's Basketball Tournament Almost Double the Women's Budget
data.description: The NCAA D-I men's basketball tournament budget for the 2018-19 season was $28 million—almost twice as much as the women's budget.

O’Leary’s proposal is up $3.7 million from current spending, a rise of less than 1%. There will be no tax increase but there […]

data.author: The Canadian Press
data.title: Federal budget 'overstates' economic impact of stimulus spending, budget officer says
data.description: OTTAWA — Parliament's spending watchdog says the federal Liberals' budget overestimates how much of an impact its stimulus measures will have on Canada's economy. The budget last month outlined what the government said was $101.4 billion in new spending over three years aimed at helping the country climb out of the economic hole caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. But the budget officer's report on Wednesday estimated that only $69 billion of that spending could be considered stimulus. Yves Giroux said that spending would boost economic growth by one per cent next year and create 74,000 jobs...
